availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John A. Peebles (Adair County, Kentucky, x)

body.p: Adair County, Kentucky, grocer, clerk, attorney, and claims agent. North Carolina native. Son of Elizabeth Peebles. Grocer in Adair County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in Adair County in 1850. Clerk in Adair County in 1860. Claim agent in the firm Bramlette, Peebles, and Bramlette, with Thomas E. Bramlette and James T. Bramlette in Columbia in 1863. Attorney in Columbia in 1864. Attorney in Adair County in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 1, p. 12B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 1, p. 13.

Internal Revenue Assessment Lists for Kentucky, 1862-1866 NARA RG 58, Microfilm Series M768, Roll 05, Adair County, Kentucky, 1863, p. 31.
Internal Revenue Assessment Lists for Kentucky, 1862-1866 NARA RG 58, Microfilm Series M768, Roll 06, Adair County, Kentucky, 1864, p. 15.
Internal Revenue Assessment Lists for Kentucky, 1862-1866 NARA RG 58, Microfilm Series M768, Roll 07, Adair County, Kentucky, 1865, p. 64.
"Resolutions on the Death of John A Peebles and Timoleon Cavens." Daily Courier, (Louisville, KY), November 27, 1866.
